required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Case Report of Nerve Root Sleeve Reinforcement and Reconstruction and Sacral Canal Plasty for the Treatment of Sacral Canal
clinical_study.official_title: Case Report of Nerve Root Sleeve Reinforcement and Reconstruction and Sacral Canal Plasty for the Treatment of Sacral Canal

brief_summary.textblock: A retrospective study of the changes in the VAS scores and imaging examinations after the reconstruction and reinforcement of nerve root sleeves and caudal angioplasty for the treatment of sacral cysts from August 2017 to January 2018 was used to evaluate the efficacy of the surgical prescription.

detailed_description.textblock: Objective: To clarify the curative effect of nerve root sleeve reconstruction and reinforcement and caudal plasty in the treatment of sacral cysts Design: A retrospective study of the changes in the VAS score and imaging examinations after the reconstruction and reinforcement of nerve root sleeves and sacral canoplasty for the treatment of sacral cysts from August 2017 to January 2018 to evaluate the efficacy of the surgical prescription.

primary_outcome.measure: Symptomatic nerve root cyst diagnosed by MRI
primary_outcome.description: The capsule of the cyst is intact and the sacral lamina is not defective ,No other diseases of the nervous system, pelvic floor and important organs Reconstruction of patients with artificial dural nerve root sleeve reinforcement

arm_group.arm_group_label: the treatment of sacral cysts in patients with sacral cysts by using nerve root sleeve reinforcement
arm_group.description: The clinical data of patients with sacral cysts treated with nerve root sleeve reinforcement and reconstruction of the sacral canal cyst were summarized and followed up from 3 to 6 months after the operation to form a case summary and report.

intervention.description: treatment of sacral cysts in patients with sacral cysts by using nerve root sleeve reinforcement
intervention.arm_group_label: the treatment of sacral cysts in patients with sacral cysts by using nerve root sleeve reinforcement

study_pop.textblock: Clinical data (symptoms, signs, imaging findings) of patients with sacral cysts treated with sacral cyst reconstruction using nerve root sleeve reinforcement

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:a) Symptomatic nerve root cyst diagnosed by MRI b) The capsule of the cyst is intact and the sacral lamina is not defective c) No other diseases of the nervous system, pelvic floor and important organs d) Reconstruction of patients with artificial dural nerve root sleeve reinforcement -
Exclusion Criteria:a) Non-radiotomy cyst or asymptomatic cyst b) The cyst causes severe bone erosion to lamina absorption c) Combined with other diseases of the nervous system, pelvic floor and important organs d) Those who have not used artificial dura mater for nerve root sleeve reinforcement and reconstruction
-
